item.title: 自动驾驶玩家 QCraft 将在德国设立欧洲总部
item.description: 中国自动驾驶解决方案制造商 QCraft 周一表示，将在德国设立欧洲总部，并与美国芯片公司高通公司（Qualcomm）合作。【原文：Chinese autonomous driving solutions maker QCraft said on Monday that it will open its European headquarters in Germany and is partnering with U.S. chip company Qualcomm .】

item.title: 互联网监测员称土耳其限制访问 X、YouTube 等网络平台
item.description: 全球互联网监测机构 Netblocks 周一表示，在土耳其，包括 X、YouTube、Instagram、Facebook、TikTok 和 WhatsApp 在内的多个网络平台的访问受到限制。【原文：Netblocks, a global internet monitor, said on Monday that access to online platforms including X, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok and WhatsApp has been restricted in Turkey on multiple networks.】

item.title: 中国电商企业正被价格战 "蹂躏
item.description: 中国主要网络公司为赢得 "即时零售 "大战而展开的激烈争夺，预计将进一步压低它们的中短期利润，并加剧世界第二大经济体的通货紧缩压力。【原文：The bitter battle among China's major online companies to win the "instant retail" war is expected to further depress their short- to medium-term profits and contribute to deflationary pressures in the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 聚焦：西班牙电信期待并购为欧洲电信业带来更广阔的前景
item.description: 西班牙电信集团 Telefonica 首席执行官马克-穆特拉（Marc Murtra）为欧洲电信业描绘了更广阔的愿景，该公司正寻求购买电信资产，并通过出售其拉丁美洲西班牙语资产来释放资源。【原文：Spanish telecoms group Telefonica is looking to buy telecom assets and free up resources by selling its Spanish-speaking Latin American assets, as CEO Marc Murtra plots a broader vision for Europe's telco sector.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车制造商在慕尼黑车展上直面关税和中国竞争
item.description: 在欧洲汽车业面临美国提高关税、电气化成本高昂以及中国汽车制造商在本土扩张等危机之际，各大汽车制造商将于周一在慕尼黑车展上展示其最新车型。【原文：Major automakers will showcase their latest models at Munich's car show on Monday as Europe's automotive sector faces crises ranging from U.S. tariff hikes to costly electrification and the expansion of Chinese automakers on their home turf.】

item.title: 雪佛龙将在韩国 "大力投资 "炼油和石化行业
item.description: 美国石油巨头雪佛龙公司（Chevron）的一位高管周一在亚太石油大会上表示，该公司预计将在韩国 "大力投资 "炼油和石化行业。【原文：Chevron expects to go "investment heavy" in South Korea on refining and petrochemicals, an executive with the U.S. oil major said at the Asia Pacific Petroleum Conference on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞标从一场政治风波到另一场政治风波
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天：【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee:】

item.title: 中国写字楼开发商提供优惠、降低租金吸引租户
item.description: 中国的商业地产开发商在与全国各地屡创新高的空置率作斗争的同时，正试图通过提供增值服务吸引租户，例如除了降低租金外，还为电动汽车充电提供补贴。【原文：Chinese commercial property developers are seeking to lure tenants with value-added services such as subsidies for charging electric vehicles in addition to lower rents, as they battle record-high vacancy rates across the country.】

item.title: 香港加密货币交易所 HashKey 将推出 5 亿美元的数字财政基金
item.description: 香港最大的持牌加密货币交易所 HashKey Group 周一表示，该公司将推出首只以数字资产财政（DAT）为重点的基金，初始目标规模为 5 亿美元。【原文：HashKey Group will launch its inaugural Digital Asset Treasury (DAT) focused fund with an initial target size of $500 million, Hong Kong's largest licensed crypto exchange said on Monday.】

item.title: 报告称，特朗普政策导致美国太阳能安装量预测下降
item.description: 一个重要的贸易组织周一在一份报告中说，与唐纳德-特朗普总统的税法通过之前相比，美国太阳能产业在2026年至2030年期间的装机容量有可能减少27%。【原文：The U.S. solar industry is at risk of installing 27% less capacity between 2026 and 2030 than before the passage of President Donald Trump's tax law that rolled back subsidies for such projects, a key trade group said in a report on Monday.】

item.title: 独家报道白宫施压，美国 FDA 将快速审查尼古丁袋
item.description: 根据路透社看到的会议记录，在特朗普政府要求加快审批速度的压力下，美国食品和药物管理局计划在周一启动的一项试点计划中对四家烟草公司的尼古丁袋进行快速审查。【原文：The U.S. Food and Drug Administration plans to fast-track reviews of four tobacco firms' nicotine pouches in a pilot program launching on Monday, amid pressure from the Trump administration to speed up approvals, according to meeting transcripts seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国就业数据疲软，StanChart 将美联储 9 月降息预期下调至 50 个基点
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered）周五在一份报告中称，在8月份就业增长远低于预期、失业率升至4.3%之后，渣打银行预计美国联邦储备委员会将在9月17日的会议上降息50个基点。【原文：Standard Chartered expects the U.S. Federal Reserve to cut interest rates by 50 basis points at its September 17 meeting, after August jobs growth came in far below expectations and unemployment rose to 4.3%, it said in a note on Friday.】

item.title: 中国 8 月出口增速为 6 个月来最慢，低于预期
item.description: 由于中国政府与第一大消费市场达成的关税休战协议所带来的暂时提振作用逐渐消失，中国的出口增长在 8 月份放缓，受对美出口疲软的拖累，第四季度采取进一步财政刺激措施的呼声持续高涨。【原文：China's export growth slowed in August, weighed down by weaker shipments to the U.S. as a temporary boost from Beijing's tariff truce with its top consumer market fades, keeping alive calls for further fiscal stimulus in the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 我们已经结束了吗？欧洲央行会议前市场面临的五个问题
item.description: 欧洲中央银行将在周四举行的连续第二次会议上保持利率稳定，投资者将密切关注该行是否有任何迹象表明其已完成降息。【原文：The European Central Bank is set to hold interest rates steady for a second straight meeting on Thursday, with investors watching for any hints that the bank is done with cutting them.】

item.title: 现代汽车遭袭击后，特朗普称外国公司需要培训美国人
item.description: 继上周现代汽车 005380.KS 位于美国佐治亚州的制造工厂遭到突袭后，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周日表示，外国公司需要雇佣和培训美国工人，并尊重移民法。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Sunday that foreign companies need to hire and train American workers and respect immigration laws, following a raid at a Hyundai Motor 005380.KS manufacturing facility in the U.S. state of Georgia last week.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 Woolworths 和 Coles 公司警告称，在法院对工资案作出裁决后将产生额外成本
item.description: 澳大利亚顶级连锁超市伍尔沃斯（Woolworths）和科尔斯（Coles）周一表示，在联邦法院就历史上少付给员工的工资作出裁决后，它们可能会产生数百万美元的额外补救费用。【原文：Australia's top supermarket chains Woolworths and Coles said on Monday they could incur millions in additional remediation costs following the federal court's decision on historical underpayments to staff.】

item.title: 股市因降息乐观情绪而上涨，日元在石破辞职后下跌
item.description: 周一，在令人沮丧的美国劳动力数据确定了本月降息的理由之后，股市上涨，美元震荡，而日元下跌，因为投资者对日本首相石破茂辞职后的不确定性做好了准备。【原文：Stocks rose and the dollar wobbled on Monday after dismal U.S. labour data sealed the case for rate cuts this month, while the yen fell as investors girded for uncertainty in Japan following the resignation of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.】

item.title: 日本第二季度国内生产总值因消费支出强劲而上调
item.description: 日本政府周一公布的数据显示，在消费上调的支撑下，日本经济在 4 月至 6 月期间按年率计算比上一季度增长了 2.2%，远高于初值。【原文：Japan's economy expanded an annualised 2.2% in the April-June period from the previous quarter, much faster than the preliminary reading, anchored by upward revision in consumption, government data showed on Monday.】

item.title: 日本首相石破辞职后日元下滑
item.description: 日本首相石破茂辞职的消息传出后，日元周一大跌，而美元则因美国疲软的就业报告巩固了美联储本月降息的预期而暴跌，目前仍处于亏损状态。【原文：The yen fell broadly on Monday following news that Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba had resigned, while the dollar was nursing losses after tumbling on a weak U.S. jobs report that cemented expectations for a Federal Reserve rate cut this month.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车行业敦促欧盟不要推迟二氧化碳排放目标
item.description: 欧洲电动汽车行业的 150 多位老板周一签署了一封信，敦促欧盟坚持 2035 年的汽车和货车零排放目标。【原文：Over 150 bosses from Europe's electric car industry signed a letter on Monday urging the European Union to stick to its 2035 zero emission target for cars and vans.】

item.title: 欧佩克+同意自 10 月起放缓增产步伐，油价上涨
item.description: 石油输出国组织（OPEC+）上周末同意进一步提高石油产量，但由于预计全球需求将减弱，从10月份起将放缓提高石油产量的步伐，油价周一早盘上涨，收窄了上周的跌幅。【原文：Oil prices rose on Monday in early trade, paring last week's losses, after OPEC+ agreed over the weekend to raise output further but at a slower pace from October due to an anticipated weakening of global demand.】

item.title: 报告称，欧盟汽车制造商接近排放目标，但梅赛德斯落在后面
item.description: 周一发布的一份报告显示，由于新型电动汽车的销量有望激增，除梅赛德斯-奔驰外，所有欧洲汽车制造商都有望实现欧盟 2025-2027 年的碳排放目标。【原文：All European carmakers except Mercedes-Benz are on track to meet the European Union's 2025-2027 carbon emission targets thanks to an expected surge in sales of new electric vehicles, according to a report published on Monday.】

item.title: 高级时装的高风险：品牌在时装秀上押宝奢侈品复兴
item.description: 香奈儿（Chanel）和迪奥（Dior）等顶级时尚品牌将在未来几周的时装秀上推出新的设计师系列，旨在重燃购物者对这个上周失去了一位伟大设计师乔治-阿玛尼（Giorgio Armani）的伤痕累累的奢侈品行业的兴趣。【原文：Chanel and Dior are among a record number of top fashion brands that will introduce new designers' collections on the catwalk in the coming weeks, aiming to reignite shoppers' interest in a bruised luxury industry that lost one of its greats, Giorgio Armani, last week.】

item.title: 据 TechCrunch 报道，现代汽车的 eVTOL 初创公司 Supernal 在高管离职后暂停工作
item.description: 据 TechCrunch 周日援引两位知情人士的话报道，在最近裁员以及首席执行官和首席技术官离职之后，现代汽车的电动空中出租车初创公司 Supernal 暂停了飞机项目的工作。【原文：Hyundai's electric air taxi startup Supernal has paused work on its aircraft program after recent staff cuts and the departure of its CEO and chief technology officer, TechCrunch reported on Sunday, citing two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯在艰难的中国市场坚持 "价值重于销量 "的策略
item.description: 德国豪华汽车制造商梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）将在其主要市场中国坚持其高端战略，由于中国消费者越来越多地转向价格更低的国产车型，残酷的价格战已使梅赛德斯-奔驰失去了市场份额。【原文：German luxury automaker Mercedes-Benz is sticking with its premium strategy in its main market China, where a brutal pricing war has cost the group market share as local customers increasingly switch to cheaper domestic models.】

item.title: 中国电池制造商 CATL 预计将于 2026 年初在匈牙利投产
item.description: 中国电池制造商 CATL 欧洲区总经理周日表示，该公司在匈牙利的新工厂预计将于明年初投产，因为该公司正寻求在该地区实现增长。【原文：Chinese battery maker CATL's new plant in Hungary is expected to start production by early next year, its general manager for Europe said on Sunday, as the company looks to the region for growth.】

item.title: 独家报道独家报道领投最新一轮融资后，ASML 成为 Mistral AI 的第一大股东
item.description: 消息人士称，本轮融资将使 Mistral 成为欧洲最有价值的人工智能公司，其最新 C 轮融资的投前估值高达 100 亿欧元。【原文：The round will make Mistral the most valuable AI company in Europe with a 10-billion-euro pre-money valuation in its latest Series C funding round, sources said.】

item.title: 白宫哈塞特称美联储需要完全独立于特朗普
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的一名高级助手周日表示，美联储应该 "完全独立于政治影响"，包括来自特朗普的政治影响。【原文：A top aide to U.S. President Donald Trump who is on his short list to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve said on Sunday that the central bank should be "fully independent of political influence," including from Trump.】

item.title: 美国高官称现代汽车突袭后将针对更多企业采取行动
item.description: 白宫一位高级官员周日表示，在对位于佐治亚州的现代汽车公司设施进行突袭导致数百人被捕后，唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府计划针对更多企业实施移民执法。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration plans to target more businesses for immigration enforcement after a raid on a Hyundai facility in Georgia led to hundreds of arrests, a top White House official said on Sunday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美国调查针对中美贸易谈判的恶意软件电子邮件
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日报道，美国当局正在调查一封来自共和党议员的假电子邮件，其中包含的恶意软件显然是为了让中国了解特朗普政府与北京的贸易谈判。【原文：U.S. authorities are investigating a bogus email from a Republican lawmaker that contained malware apparently aimed at giving China insights into the Trump administration's trade talks with Beijing, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.】
